etymology.interpretation: Phonetic 𧮫 gave the sound value (later aligning with modern què), while 卩, depicting a seal or kneeling person, contributes a human/action semantic cue. This fits senses like “to draw back/retreat,” and the concessive use “however” arose through grammaticalization in context.
etymology.simplification: Mainland reform replaced the obscure phonetic 𧮫 with the simpler, common 去, preserving the right-side semantic 卩 while using a graph that echoes the modern sound and reduces stroke count.

examples.chinese: 我很想去，却没有钱(我很想去，卻沒有錢)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ hěn xiǎng qù, què méiyǒu qián.
examples.english: I really want to go; however, I don’t have money.

examples.chinese: 军队被迫退却(軍隊被迫退卻)。
examples.english: The army was forced to retreat.

examples.chinese: 他说得很有道理，却没有说服大家(他說得很有道理，卻沒有說服大家)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shuō de hěn yǒu dàolǐ, què méiyǒu shuōfú dàjiā.
examples.english: He made good points; however, he didn’t convince everyone.
